headers.subject: PPP glitches resolved
headers.received: (from rnordier@localhost) by eac.iafrica.com (8.6.12/8.6.12) id NAA00341 for questions@freebsd.org; Thu, 4 Jan 1996 13:45:48 +0200

body.para: On Sat, 30 Dec 1995, Robert Nordier wrote as follows:

quote.quotepara: I set up user PPP a few days ago and have been having a few problems.
Basically, everything works fine during the first dial-in. But reconnecting later sometimes results in one of two error messages:
1) SIOCAIFADDR: File exists 2) rtinit: wrong ifa (0xf0509d00) was (0xf0506980)

body.para: The good news is now that iij-ppp is working, with no SIOCAIFADDR or rtinit errors, and actually handles all the route adding and cleanup by itself correctly and automatically, without help from the route(8) utility.
To everyone who gave advice, thanks very much, and thanks particularly to Richard Lyon and Doug White for help in finally getting the correct configuration sorted out.
